doc.summary: The provider will not process this block.
doc.text: The provider will not process this block.

doc.summary: The provider will add a block state for a custom manual model
doc.text: The provider will add a block state for a custom manual model

doc.summary: The provider will add a block state with the given model
doc.text: The provider will add a block state with the given model

parameters.name: renderTypes
parameters.doc: The default RenderTypeGroup to use, or null for no render types (ie the default BlockModelProvider)

doc.summary: Gets a <ref cls="net/minecraftforge/client/model/generators/BlockModelProvider">BlockModelProvider</ref> which assigns the given <ref cls="net/minecraftforge/client/RenderTypeGroup">RenderTypeGroup</ref> to each created builder.
doc.text: Gets a <ref cls="net/minecraftforge/client/model/generators/BlockModelProvider">BlockModelProvider</ref> which assigns the given <ref cls="net/minecraftforge/client/RenderTypeGroup">RenderTypeGroup</ref> to each created builder.

doc.summary: Makes <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="models" type="()net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.BlockModelProvider">#models()</ref> behave as if it <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="models" type="(net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation)net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.BlockModelProvider">#models(ResourceLocation)</ref> was called with the given argument.
doc.text: Makes <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="models" type="()net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.BlockModelProvider">#models()</ref> behave as if it <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="models" type="(net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation)net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.BlockModelProvider">#models(ResourceLocation)</ref> was called with the given argument.

doc.summary: Creates a block state for the given block using the given model.
doc.text: Creates a block state for the given block using the given model. The default implementation checks  whether the block has the properties <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/state/properties/BlockStateProperties" field="HORIZONTAL_FACING">BlockStateProperties#HORIZONTAL_FACING</ref> or  <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/state/properties/BlockStateProperties" field="FACING">BlockStateProperties#FACING</ref> and creates block states matching those.  If you don't use the model, don't call the supplier, so the default model is not generated.

doc.summary: Creates a model for the given block.
doc.text: Creates a model for the given block. The default implementation creates special models for blocks  of type <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/LiquidBlock">LiquidBlock</ref> and <ref cls="net/minecraft/world/level/block/LeavesBlock">LeavesBlock</ref>.

doc.summary: Creates a block state and models for a button.
doc.text: Creates a block state and models for a button.

doc.summary: Creates a block state and models for a pressure plate.
doc.text: Creates a block state and models for a pressure plate.

doc.summary: A base class for block state and model providers.
doc.text: A base class for block state and model providers. An extending class should call the  <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="manualState" type="(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block)void">manualState</ref> and <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="manualModel" type="(net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block)void">manualModel</ref> methods in  <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="setup" type="()void">setup</ref>.  Another thing you can do is override <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="defaultState" type="(net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation,net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block,java.util.function.Supplier<net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.ModelFile>)void">defaultState</ref>  and <ref cls="org/moddingx/libx/datagen/provider/model/BlockStateProviderBase" method="defaultModel" type="(net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation,net.minecraft.world.level.block.Block)net.minecraftforge.client.model.generators.ModelFile">defaultModel</ref> to adjust the state and model depending  on the block.
